verses.text: Now it came to pass after \w this|strong="H0310"\w*, that \w Nahash|strong="H5176"\w* the \w king|strong="H4428"\w* of the \w children|strong="H1121"\w* of \w Ammon|strong="H5983"\w* \w died|strong="H4191"\w*, and his \w son|strong="H1121"\w* \w reigned|strong="H4427"\w* in his stead.

And \w David|strong="H1732"\w* \w said|strong="H0559"\w*, I will \w shew|strong="H6213"\w* \w kindness|strong="H2617"\w* unto \w Hanun|strong="H2586"\w* the \w son|strong="H1121"\w* of \w Nahash|strong="H5176"\w*, because his \w father|strong="H0001"\w* \w shewed|strong="H6213"\w* \w kindness|strong="H2617"\w* to me. And \w David|strong="H1732"\w* \w sent|strong="H7971"\w* \w messengers|strong="H4397"\w* to \w comfort|strong="H5162"\w* him concerning his \w father|strong="H0001"\w*. So the \w servants|strong="H5650"\w* of \w David|strong="H1732"\w* \w came|strong="H0935"\w* into the \w land|strong="H0776"\w* of the \w children|strong="H1121"\w* of \w Ammon|strong="H5983"\w* to \w Hanun|strong="H2586"\w*, to \w comfort|strong="H5162"\w* him.

But the \w princes|strong="H8269"\w* of the \w children|strong="H1121"\w* of \w Ammon|strong="H5983"\w* \w said|strong="H0559"\w* to \w Hanun|strong="H2586"\w*, \w Thinkest|strong="H5869"\w* thou that \w David|strong="H1732"\w* doth \w honour|strong="H3513"\w* thy \w father|strong="H0001"\w*, that he hath \w sent|strong="H7971"\w* \w comforters|strong="H5162"\w* unto thee? are not his \w servants|strong="H5650"\w* \w come|strong="H0935"\w* unto thee for to \w search|strong="H2713"\w*, and to \w overthrow|strong="H2015"\w*, and to spy \w out|strong="H7270"\w* the \w land|strong="H0776"\w*?\f + \fr 19.3 \ft Thinkest…: Heb. In thine eyes doth David, etc\f*

Wherefore \w Hanun|strong="H2586"\w* \w took|strong="H3947"\w* \w David’s|strong="H1732"\w* \w servants|strong="H5650"\w*, and \w shaved|strong="H1548"\w* them, and cut \w off|strong="H3772"\w* their \w garments|strong="H4063"\w* in the \w midst|strong="H2677"\w* hard by their \w buttocks|strong="H4667"\w*, and sent them \w away|strong="H7971"\w*.

Then there \w went|strong="H3212"\w* \add certain\add*, and \w told|strong="H5046"\w* \w David|strong="H1732"\w* how the \w men|strong="H0582"\w* were served. And he \w sent|strong="H7971"\w* to \w meet|strong="H7125"\w* them: for the \w men|strong="H0582"\w* were \w greatly|strong="H3966"\w* \w ashamed|strong="H3637"\w*. And the \w king|strong="H4428"\w* \w said|strong="H0559"\w*, \w Tarry|strong="H3427"\w* at \w Jericho|strong="H3405"\w* until your \w beards|strong="H2206"\w* be \w grown|strong="H6779"\w*, and \add then\add* \w return|strong="H7725"\w*.

¶ And when the \w children|strong="H1121"\w* of \w Ammon|strong="H5983"\w* \w saw|strong="H7200"\w* that they had made themselves \w odious|strong="H0887"\w* to \w David|strong="H1732"\w*, \w Hanun|strong="H2586"\w* and the \w children|strong="H1121"\w* of \w Ammon|strong="H5983"\w* \w sent|strong="H7971"\w* a \w thousand|strong="H0505"\w* \w talents|strong="H3603"\w* of \w silver|strong="H3701"\w* to \w hire|strong="H7936"\w* them \w chariots|strong="H7393"\w* and \w horsemen|strong="H6571"\w* out of \w Mesopotamia|strong="H0763"\w*, and out of \w Syria-maachah|strong="H0758"\w*, and out of \w Zobah|strong="H6678"\w*.\f + \fr 19.6 \ft odious: Heb. to stink\f*

So they \w hired|strong="H7936"\w* \w thirty|strong="H7970"\w* and \w two|strong="H8147"\w* \w thousand|strong="H0505"\w* \w chariots|strong="H7393"\w*, and the \w king|strong="H4428"\w* of \w Maachah|strong="H4601"\w* and his \w people|strong="H5971"\w*; who \w came|strong="H0935"\w* and \w pitched|strong="H2583"\w* \w before|strong="H6440"\w* \w Medeba|strong="H4311"\w*. And the \w children|strong="H1121"\w* of \w Ammon|strong="H5983"\w* gathered themselves \w together|strong="H0622"\w* from their \w cities|strong="H5892"\w*, and \w came|strong="H0935"\w* to \w battle|strong="H4421"\w*.

And when \w David|strong="H1732"\w* \w heard|strong="H8085"\w* \add of it\add*, he \w sent|strong="H7971"\w* \w Joab|strong="H3097"\w*, and all the \w host|strong="H6635"\w* of the mighty \w men|strong="H1368"\w*.

And the \w children|strong="H1121"\w* of \w Ammon|strong="H5983"\w* came \w out|strong="H3318"\w*, and put the \w battle|strong="H4421"\w* in \w array|strong="H6186"\w* before the \w gate|strong="H6607"\w* of the \w city|strong="H5892"\w*: and the \w kings|strong="H4428"\w* that were \w come|strong="H0935"\w* \add were\add* by themselves in the \w field|strong="H7704"\w*.

Now when \w Joab|strong="H3097"\w* \w saw|strong="H7200"\w* that the \w battle|strong="H4421"\w* was set against him \w before|strong="H6440"\w* and \w behind|strong="H0268"\w*, he chose \w out|strong="H0977"\w* of all the \w choice|strong="H0977"\w* of \w Israel|strong="H3478"\w*, and put \add them\add* in \w array|strong="H6186"\w* \w against|strong="H7125"\w* the \w Syrians|strong="H0758"\w*.\f + \fr 19.10 \ft the battle…: Heb. the face of the battle was\f*\f + \fr 19.10 \ft choice: or, young men\f*

And the \w rest|strong="H3499"\w* of the \w people|strong="H5971"\w* he \w delivered|strong="H5414"\w* unto the \w hand|strong="H3027"\w* of \w Abishai|strong="H0052"\w* his \w brother|strong="H0251"\w*, and they set \add themselves\add* in \w array|strong="H6186"\w* \w against|strong="H7125"\w* the \w children|strong="H1121"\w* of \w Ammon|strong="H5983"\w*.\f + \fr 19.11 \ft Abishai: Heb. Abshai\f*

And he \w said|strong="H0559"\w*, If the \w Syrians|strong="H0758"\w* be too \w strong|strong="H2388"\w* for me, then thou shalt \w help|strong="H8668"\w* me: but if the \w children|strong="H1121"\w* of \w Ammon|strong="H5983"\w* be too \w strong|strong="H2388"\w* for thee, then I will \w help|strong="H3467"\w* thee.

Be of good \w courage|strong="H2388"\w*, and let us behave ourselves \w valiantly|strong="H2388"\w* for our \w people|strong="H5971"\w*, and for the \w cities|strong="H5892"\w* of our \w God|strong="H0430"\w*: and let the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* \w do|strong="H6213"\w* \add that which is\add* \w good|strong="H2896"\w* in his \w sight|strong="H5869"\w*.

So \w Joab|strong="H3097"\w* and the \w people|strong="H5971"\w* that \add were\add* with him drew \w nigh|strong="H5066"\w* \w before|strong="H6440"\w* the \w Syrians|strong="H0758"\w* unto the \w battle|strong="H4421"\w*; and they \w fled|strong="H5127"\w* \w before|strong="H6440"\w* him.

And when the \w children|strong="H1121"\w* of \w Ammon|strong="H5983"\w* \w saw|strong="H7200"\w* that the \w Syrians|strong="H0758"\w* were \w fled|strong="H5127"\w*, they likewise \w fled|strong="H5127"\w* \w before|strong="H6440"\w* \w Abishai|strong="H0052"\w* his \w brother|strong="H0251"\w*, and \w entered|strong="H0935"\w* into the \w city|strong="H5892"\w*. Then \w Joab|strong="H3097"\w* \w came|strong="H0935"\w* to \w Jerusalem|strong="H3389"\w*.

¶ And when the \w Syrians|strong="H0758"\w* \w saw|strong="H7200"\w* that they were put to the \w worse|strong="H5062"\w* \w before|strong="H6440"\w* \w Israel|strong="H3478"\w*, they \w sent|strong="H7971"\w* \w messengers|strong="H4397"\w*, and drew \w forth|strong="H3318"\w* the \w Syrians|strong="H0758"\w* that \add were\add* \w beyond|strong="H5676"\w* the \w river|strong="H5104"\w*: and \w Shophach|strong="H7780"\w* the \w captain|strong="H8269"\w* of the \w host|strong="H6635"\w* of \w Hadarezer|strong="H1928"\w* \add went\add* \w before|strong="H6440"\w* them.\f + \fr 19.16 \ft river: that is, Euphrates\f*\f + \fr 19.16 \ft Shophach: also called, Shobach\f*

And it was \w told|strong="H5046"\w* \w David|strong="H1732"\w*; and he \w gathered|strong="H0622"\w* all \w Israel|strong="H3478"\w*, and passed \w over|strong="H5674"\w* \w Jordan|strong="H3383"\w*, and \w came|strong="H0935"\w* upon them, and set \add the battle\add* in \w array|strong="H6186"\w* against them. So when \w David|strong="H1732"\w* had put the \w battle|strong="H4421"\w* in \w array|strong="H6186"\w* \w against|strong="H7125"\w* the \w Syrians|strong="H0758"\w*, they \w fought|strong="H3898"\w* with him.

But the \w Syrians|strong="H0758"\w* \w fled|strong="H5127"\w* \w before|strong="H6440"\w* \w Israel|strong="H3478"\w*; and \w David|strong="H1732"\w* \w slew|strong="H2026"\w* of the \w Syrians|strong="H0758"\w* \w seven|strong="H7651"\w* \w thousand|strong="H0505"\w* \add men which fought in\add* \w chariots|strong="H7393"\w*, and \w forty|strong="H0705"\w* \w thousand|strong="H0505"\w* \w footmen|strong="H0376"\w*, and \w killed|strong="H4191"\w* \w Shophach|strong="H7780"\w* the \w captain|strong="H8269"\w* of the \w host|strong="H6635"\w*.

And when the \w servants|strong="H5650"\w* of \w Hadarezer|strong="H1928"\w* \w saw|strong="H7200"\w* that they were put to the \w worse|strong="H5062"\w* \w before|strong="H6440"\w* \w Israel|strong="H3478"\w*, they made \w peace|strong="H7999"\w* with \w David|strong="H1732"\w*, and became his \w servants|strong="H5647"\w*: neither \w would|strong="H0014"\w* the \w Syrians|strong="H0758"\w* \w help|strong="H3467"\w* the \w children|strong="H1121"\w* of \w Ammon|strong="H5983"\w* any more.
